sentences: Clifford James Nobles (August 4, 1941 â€“ October 12, 2008) was an American soul singer, who is best known for his instrumental hit, "The Horse".
Nobles was born in Grove Hill, Alabama, United States; grew up in Mobile, Alabama; and began singing in high school as a member of a local group, The Delroys.
He moved to Philadelphia and recorded three singles for Atlantic Records, none of which charted.
While living in a commune in Norristown, Pennsylvania, he formed a group, Cliff Nobles & Co., with bassist Benny Williams, guitarist Bobby Tucker, and drummer Robert Marshall.
After moving to Norristown, Cliff Nobles had a daughter Yvette Blakeslee (Bradley) in July, 1977.
Nobles died in Norristown, Pennsylvania, in October 2008, at the age of 67.
